thread.title: Spirit Mountain gets more help from Duluth
thread.title_full: Spirit Mountain gets more help from Duluth

author: Mark Reilly
title: Spirit Mountain gets more help from Duluth
text:
Spirit Mountain gets more help from Duluth Aug 11, 2015, 7:08am CDT Industries & Tags Mark Reilly Managing Editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Mark Reilly Managing Editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Home of the Day See All Homes of the Day Spirit Mountain Recreation Area will get another $300,000 in financial aid from Duluth, relieving fears that the local ski and outdoor area might not be able to meet payroll. The Duluth News-Tribune reports that the City Council , in a 7-1 vote, approved shifting tourism tax revenues to Spirit Mountain. Local tourism tax collections are running $375,000 ahead of projections this year. The aid is in addition to $1.2 million in credit provided to Spirit Mountain made earlier this year. Spirit Mountain officials said last week that a poor winter led to financial troubles and it was running short of cash .
